010package imagingbook.lib.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
024
025import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.DivideByZeroException;
026import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
027
028/**
029 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
030 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
031 * objects structures. 
032 * Matrices are simply two-dimensional arrays A[r][c], where r is the row index
033 * and c is the column index (as common in linear algebra). This means that
034 * matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
035 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
036 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).</p>
037 * 
038 * <p>Methods named with a trailing 'D' (e.g., {@code multiplyD()}) operate destructively,
039 * i.e., modify one of the passed arguments.</p>
040 * 
041 * <p>Most methods are self-explanatory and are therefore left undocumented.</p>
042 * 
043 * @author W. Burger
044 * @version 2019/01/05
045 */
046public abstract class Matrix {
047        
048        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers. */
049        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
050        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements. */
051        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
052        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
053        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
054        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
055        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
056        
057        // ----  Vector and matrix creation -----------------------------
058
059        public static double[] createDoubleVector(int length) {
060                return new double[length];
061        }
062        
063        public static float[] createFloatVector(int length) {
064                return new float[length];
065        }
066        
067        public static double[][] createDoubleMatrix(int rows, int columns) {
068                return new double[rows][columns];
069        }
070        
071        public static float[][] createFloatMatrix(int rows, int columns) {
072                return new float[rows][columns];
073        }
074        
075        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
076        
077        /**
078         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued vector of the 
079         * specified length.
080         * @param length the length of the vector
081         * @return a vector with zero values
082         */
083        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
084                if (length < 1)
085                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
086                return new double[length];
087        }
088        
089        /**
090         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
091         * specified size.
092         * @param size the size of the matrix
093         * @return an identity matrix
094         */
095        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
096                if (size < 1)
097                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
098                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
099                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
100                        A[i][i] = 1;
101                }
102                return A;
103        }
104        
105        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
106
107        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
108                return A.length;
109        }
110        
111        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
112                return A[0].length;
113        }
114        
115        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
116                return A.length;
117        }
118        
119        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
120                return A[0].length;
121        }
122        
123        // Extract rows or columns
124        
125        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
126                return A[r].clone();
127        }
128        
129        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
130                final int rows = A.length;
131                double[] col = new double[rows];
132                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
133                        col[r] = A[r][c];
134                }
135                return col;
136        }
137        
138        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
139                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
140        }
141        
142        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
143                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
144        }
145        
146        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
147                return a.length == b.length;
148        }
149        
150        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
151                return a.length == b.length;
152        }
153        
154        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
155                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
156        }
157        
158        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
159                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
160        }
161
162        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
163
164        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] A) {
165                return A.clone();
166        }
167        
168        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] A) {
169                return A.clone();
170        }
171
172        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
173                final int m = A.length;
174                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
175                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
176                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
177                }
178                return B;
179        }
180        
181        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
182                final int m = A.length;
183                float[][] B = new float[m][];
184                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
185                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
186                }
187                return B;
188        }
189        
190        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
191        
192        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] A) {
193                final int m = A.length;
194                final float[] B = new float[m];
195                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
196                        B[i] = (float) A[i];
197                }
198                return B;
199        }
200        
201        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
202                final int m = A.length;
203                final int n = A[0].length;
204                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
205                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
206                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
207                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
208                        }
209                }
210                return B;
211        }
212        
213        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] A) {
214                final int m = A.length;
215                final double[] B = new double[m];
216                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
217                        B[i] = A[i];
218                }
219                return B;
220        }
221        
222        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
223                final int m = A.length;
224                final int n = A[0].length;
225                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
226                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
227                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
228                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
229                        }
230                }
231                return B;
232        }
233        
234        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
235        
236        public static void fillD(final float[] A, float val) {
237                Arrays.fill(A, val);
238        }
239        
240        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
241                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
242                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
243                }
244        }
245        
246        public static void fillD(final double[] A, double val) {
247                Arrays.fill(A, val);
248        }
249        
250        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
251                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
252                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
253                }
254        }
255        
256        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
257        
258        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
259                if (!sameSize(a, b))
260                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
261                final int n = a.length;
262                double[] c = new double[n];
263                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
264                        c[i] = a[i] + b[i];
265                }
266                return c;
267        }
268
269        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
270                if (!sameSize(A, B))
271                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
272                final int m = A.length;
273                final int n = A[0].length;
274                double[][] C = new double[m][n];
275                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
276                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
277                                C[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
278                        }
279                }
280                return C;
281        }
282        
283        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
284                if (!sameSize(a, b))
285                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
286                final int n = a.length;
287                double[] c = new double[n];
288                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
289                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
290                }
291                return c;
292        }
293
294        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
295
296        // non-destructive
297        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] a) {
298                double[] b = a.clone();
299                multiplyD(s, b);
300                return b;
301        }
302        
303        // destructive
304        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] a) {
305                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
306                        a[i] = a[i] * s;
307                }
308        }
309        
310
311        // non-destructive
312        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
313                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
314                multiplyD(s, B);
315                return B;
316        }
317        
318        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
319                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
320                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
321                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
322                        }
323                }
324        }
325        
326        // non-destructive
327        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] A) {
328                float[] B = duplicate(A);
329                multiplyD(s, B);
330                return B;
331        }
332        
333        // destructive
334        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] A) {
335                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
336                        A[i] = A[i] * s;
337                }
338        }
339
340        // non-destructive
341        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
342                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
343                multiplyD(s, B);
344                return B;
345        }
346        
347        // destructive
348        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
349                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
350                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
351                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
352                        }
353                }
354        }
355        
356        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
357
358        /**
359         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A from the right, i.e., y = x * A,
360         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
361         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
362         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
363         * @return a (row) vector of length n
364         */
365        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
366                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
367                multiplyD(x, A, y);
368                return y;
369        }
370        
371        /**
372         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
373         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
374         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
375         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
376         */
377        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException {
378                if (x == y) 
379                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
380                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
381                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
382                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
383                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
384                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
385                        double s = 0;
386                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
387                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
388                        }
389                        y[i] = s;
390                }
391        }
392
393        /**
394         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
395         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
396         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
397         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
398         * @return a (column) vector of length m
399         */
400        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
401                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
402                multiplyD(A, x, y);
403                return y;
404        }
405        
406        /**
407         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
408         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
409         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
410         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
411         */
412        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
413                if (x == y) 
414                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
415                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
416                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
417                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
418                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
419                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
420                        double s = 0;
421                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
422                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
423                        }
424                        y[i] = s;
425                }
426        }
427        
428        /**
429         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
430         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
431         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
432         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
433         * @return a (column) vector of length m
434         */
435        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
436                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
437                multiplyD(A, x, y);
438                return y;
439        }
440        
441        /**
442         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
443         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
444         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
445         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
446         */
447        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
448                if (x == y) 
449                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
450                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
451                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
452                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
453                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
454                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
455                        double s = 0;
456                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
457                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
458                        }
459                        y[i] = (float) s;
460                }
461        }
462        
463
464        
465        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
466        
467        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
468        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
469                int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
470                int q = getNumberOfColumns(B);
471                double[][] C = createDoubleMatrix(m, q);
472                multiplyD(A, B, C);
473                return C;
474        }
475        
476        // A * B -> C (destructive)
477        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
478                if (A == C || B == C) 
479                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
480                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
481                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
482                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
483                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
484                if (nA != mB)
485                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
486                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
487                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
488                                double s = 0;
489                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
490                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
491                                }
492                                C[i][j] = s;
493                        }
494                }
495        }
496        
497        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
498        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
499                // TODO: also check nA = mB
500                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
501                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
502                float[][] C = createFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
503                multiplyD(A, B, C);
504                return C;
505        }
506
507        // A * B -> C (destructive)
508        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
509                if (A == C || B == C) 
510                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
511                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
512                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
513                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
514                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
515                if (nA != mB)
516                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
517                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
518                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
519                                float s = 0;
520                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
521                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
522                                }
523                                C[i][j] = s;
524                        }
525                }
526        }
527        
528        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
529        
530        /**
531         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
532         * which must have the same length.
533         * @param x first vector
534         * @param y second vector
535         * @return the dot product
536         */
537        public static double dotProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
538                if (!sameSize(x, y))
539                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
540                double sum = 0;
541                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
542                        sum = sum + x[i] * y[i];
543                }
544                return sum;
545        }
546        
547        // A is considered a column vector, B is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
548        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
549        /**
550         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
551         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
552         * m is the length of the second vector.
553         * @param x first vector (of length m)
554         * @param y second vector (of length n)
555         * @return the outer product (matrix)
556         */
557        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
558                final int m = x.length;
559                final int n = y.length;
560                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
561                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
562                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
563                                M[i][j] = x[i] * y[j];
564                        }
565                }
566                return M;
567        }
568
569        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
570
571        /**
572         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
573         * @param x a vector
574         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
575         */
576        public static double normL1(final double[] x) {
577                double sum = 0;
578                for (double val : x) {
579                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
580                }
581                return sum;
582        }
583
584        /**
585         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
586         * @param x a vector
587         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
588         */
589        public static double normL2(final double[] x) {
590                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
591        }
592
593        /**
594         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
595         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
596         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
597         * @param x a vector
598         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
599         */
600        public static double normL2squared(final double[] x) {
601                double sum = 0;
602                for (double val : x) {
603                        sum = sum + (val * val);
604                }
605                return sum;
606        }
607        
608        /**
609         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
610         * @param x a vector
611         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
612         */
613        public static float normL1(final float[] x) {
614                double sum = 0;
615                for (double val : x) {
616                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
617                }
618                return (float) sum;
619        }
620
621        /**
622         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
623         * @param x a vector
624         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
625         */
626        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
627                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
628        }
629
630        /**
631         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
632         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
633         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
634         * @param x a vector
635         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
636         */
637        public static float normL2squared(final float[] x) {
638                double sum = 0;
639                for (double val : x) {
640                        sum = sum + (val * val);
641                }
642                return (float) sum;
643        }
644        
645        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
646        
647        /** 
648         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
649         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
650         * number of elements.
651         * @param x first vector
652         * @param y second vector
653         * @return the distance
654         */
655        public static double distL2(double[] x, double[] y) {
656                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
657        }
658        
659        /** 
660         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
661         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
662         * number of elements.
663         * @param x first vector
664         * @param y second vector
665         * @return the squared distance
666         */
667        public static double distL2squared(double[] x, double[] y) {
668                double sum = 0;
669                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
670                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
671                }
672                return sum;
673        }
674        
675        /** 
676         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
677         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
678         * number of elements.
679         * @param x first vector
680         * @param y second vector
681         * @return the distance
682         */
683        public static float distL2(float[] x, float[] y) {
684                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
685        }
686        
687        /** 
688         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
689         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
690         * number of elements.
691         * @param x first vector
692         * @param y second vector
693         * @return the squared distance
694         */
695        public static float distL2squared(float[] x, float[] y) {
696                double sum = 0;
697                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
698                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
699                }
700                return (float) sum;
701        }
702        
703        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
704        
705        /**
706         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
707         * @param A a matrix
708         * @return the norm of the matrix
709         */
710        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
711                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
712                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
713                double s = 0;
714                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
715                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
716                                s = s + A[i][j] * A[i][j];
717                        }
718                }
719                return Math.sqrt(s);
720        }
721
722        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
723
724        public static double sum(final double[] x) {
725                double sum = 0;
726                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
727                        sum = sum + x[i];
728                }
729                return sum;
730        }
731        
732        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
733                double sum = 0;
734                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
735                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
736                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
737                        }
738                }
739                return sum;
740        }
741        
742        public static float sum(final float[] x) {
743                double sum = 0;
744                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
745                        sum = sum + x[i];
746                }
747                return (float) sum;
748        }
749        
750        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
751                double sum = 0;
752                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
753                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
754                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
755                        }
756                }
757                return sum;
758        }

762        /**
763         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
764         * @param A a matrix
765         * @param row the row index
766         * @return the sum of the row's elements
767         */
768        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
769                return sum(A[row]);
770        }
771        
772        /**
773         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
774         * @param A a matrix
775         * @param row the row index
776         * @return the sum of the row's elements
777         */
778        public static float sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
779                return sum(A[row]);
780        }

783        /**
784         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
785         * @param A a matrix
786         * @param col the column index
787         * @return the sum of the column's elements
788         */
789        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
790                double sum = 0;
791                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
792                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
793                }
794                return sum;
795        }
796        
797        /**
798         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
799         * @param A a matrix
800         * @param col the column index
801         * @return the sum of the column's elements
802         */
803        public static float sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
804                double sum = 0;
805                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
806                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
807                }
808                return (float) sum;
809        }
810        
811        /**
812         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
813         * them as a vector with one element per row.
814         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
815         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
816         */
817        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
818                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
819                for (int r = 0; r < sumVec.length; r++) {
820                        double sum = 0;
821                        for (int c = 0; c < A[r].length; c++) {
822                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
823                        }
824                        sumVec[r] = sum;
825                }
826                return sumVec;
827        }
828        
829        /**
830         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
831         * them as a vector with one element per row.
832         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
833         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
834         */
835        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
836                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
837                for (int r = 0; r < sumVec.length; r++) {
838                        double sum = 0;
839                        for (int c = 0; c < A[r].length; c++) {
840                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
841                        }
842                        sumVec[r] = (float) sum;
843                }
844                return sumVec;
845        }
846        
847        /**
848         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
849         * them as a vector with one element per column.
850         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
851         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
852         */
853        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
854                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
855                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
856                        double sum = 0;
857                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
858                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
859                        }
860                        sumVec[c] = sum;
861                }
862                return sumVec;
863        }
864        
865        /**
866         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
867         * them as a vector with one element per column.
868         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
869         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
870         */
871        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
872                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
873                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
874                        double sum = 0;
875                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
876                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
877                        }
878                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
879                }
880                return sumVec;
881        }
882        
883        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
884        
885        public static float min(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
886                if (x.length == 0)
887                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
888                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
889                for (float val : x) {
890                        if (val < minval) {
891                                minval = val;
892                        }
893                }
894                return minval;
895        }
896        
897        public static double min(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
898                if (x.length == 0)
899                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
900                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
901                for (double val : x) {
902                        if (val < minval) {
903                                minval = val;
904                        }
905                }
906                return minval;
907        }
908        
909        public static float max(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
910                if (x.length == 0)
911                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
912                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
913                for (float val : x) {
914                        if (val > maxval) {
915                                maxval = val;
916                        }
917                }
918                return maxval;
919        }
920        
921        public static double max(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
922                if (x.length == 0)
923                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
924                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
925                for (double val : x) {
926                        if (val > maxval) {
927                                maxval = val;
928                        }
929                }
930                return maxval;
931        }
932        
933        public static double max(double[][] A) {
934                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
935                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
936                        for (double val : A[r]) {
937                                if (val > maxval) {
938                                        maxval = val;
939                                }
940                        }
941                }
942                return maxval;
943        }
944        
945        public static float max(float[][] A) {
946                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
947                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
948                        for (float val : A[r]) {
949                                if (val > maxval) {
950                                        maxval = val;
951                                }
952                        }
953                }
954                return maxval;
955        }
956        
957        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
958        
959        /**
960         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
961         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
962         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
963         */
964        public static float[] join(float[]... xs) {
965                int n = 0;
966                for (float[] x : xs) {
967                        n = n + x.length;
968                }
969                float[] va = new float[n];
970                int j = 0;
971                for (float[] x : xs) {
972                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
973                                va[j] = x[i];
974                                j++;
975                        }
976                }               
977                return va;
978        }
979
980        /**
981         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
982         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
983         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
984         */
985        public static double[] join(double[]... xs) {
986                int n = 0;
987                for (double[] x : xs) {
988                        n = n + x.length;
989                }
990                double[] va = new double[n];    
991                int j = 0;
992                for (double[] x : xs) {
993                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
994                                va[j] = x[i];
995                                j++;
996                        }
997                }               
998                return va;
999        }
1000        
1001        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
1002        
1003        /**
1004         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
1005         * vector, which contains an additional 1-element.
1006         * @param xc a Cartesian vector
1007         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
1008         */
1009        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] xc) {
1010                double[] xh = new double[xc.length + 1];
1011                for (int i = 0; i < xc.length; i++) {
1012                        xh[i] = xc[i];
1013                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
1014                }
1015                return xh;
1016        }
1017        
1018        /**
1019         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
1020         * vector, which is one element shorter.
1021         * @param xh a homogeneous vector
1022         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
1023         */
1024        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] xh) throws DivideByZeroException {
1025                double[] xc = new double[xh.length - 1];
1026                final double s = 1 / xh[xh.length - 1];
1027                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
1028                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
1029                for (int i = 0; i < xh.length - 1; i++) {
1030                        xc[i] = s * xh[i];
1031                }
1032                return xc;
1033        }
1034        
1035        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
1036        
1037        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1038                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1039                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1040                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1041        }
1042        
1043        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1044                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1045                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1046                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1047        }
1048        
1049        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1050                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1051                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1052                return
1053                                A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
1054                                A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
1055                                A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
1056                                A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
1057                                A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
1058                                A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1059        }
1060
1061        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1062                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1063                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1064                return 
1065                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
1066                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
1067                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
1068                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
1069                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
1070                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1071        }
1072        
1073        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1074                if (!isSquare(A))
1075                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1076                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1077                return new LUDecomposition(M).getDeterminant();
1078        }
1079        
1080        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
1081        
1082        public static double trace(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1083                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1084                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1085                if (m != n) 
1086                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1087                double s = 0;
1088                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1089                                s = s + A[i][i];
1090                }
1091                return s;
1092        }
1093        
1094        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
1095        
1096        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
1097                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1098                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1099                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
1100                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1101                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1102                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1103                        }
1104                }
1105                return At;
1106        }
1107        
1108        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
1109                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1110                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1111                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
1112                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1113                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1114                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1115                        }
1116                }
1117                return At;
1118        }
1119        
1120        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
1121        
1122        /**
1123         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1124         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
1125         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1126         * @param A a square matrix
1127         * @return the inverse matrix
1128         */
1129        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1130                if (!isSquare(A))
1131                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1132                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1133                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
1134        }
1135        
1136        /**
1137         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1138         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
1139         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1140         * @param A a square matrix
1141         * @return the inverse matrix
1142         */
1143        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1144                if (!isSquare(A))
1145                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1146                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
1147                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
1148        }
1149
1150        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
1151        
1152        /**
1153         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear systems of equations
1154         * A * x = b. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
1155         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1156         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
1157         * @param b a vector of length n
1158         * @return the solution vector of length n
1159         */
1160        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
1161                RealMatrix AA = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1162                RealVector bb = MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b);
1163                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(AA).getSolver();
1164//              double[] x = null;
1165//              try {
1166//                      x = solver.solve(bb).toArray();
1167//              } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
1168                return solver.solve(bb).toArray();
1169        }
1170        
1171        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
1172        
1173        public static String toString(double[] x) {
1174                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1175                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1176                printToStream(x, strm);
1177                return bas.toString();
1178        }
1179        
1180        public static String toString(float[] x) {
1181                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1182                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1183                printToStream(x, strm);
1184                return bas.toString();
1185        }
1186        
1187        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
1188                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1189                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1190                printToStream(A, strm);
1191                return bas.toString();
1192        }
1193        
1194        public static String toString(float[][] A) {
1195                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1196                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1197                printToStream(A, strm);
1198                return bas.toString();
1199        }
1200        
1201        // --------------------
1202        
1203        public static void printToStream(double[] x, PrintStream strm) {
1204                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1205                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1206                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1207                        if (i > 0)
1208                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1209                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, x[i]);
1210                }
1211                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1212                strm.flush();
1213        }
1214        
1215        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1216                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1217                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1218                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1219                        if (i == 0)
1220                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1221                        else
1222                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1223                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
1224                                if (j == 0) 
1225                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1226                                else
1227                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1228                        }
1229                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1230                }
1231                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1232                strm.flush();
1233        }
1234        
1235        public static void printToStream(float[] A, PrintStream strm) {
1236                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1237                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1238                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1239                        if (i > 0)
1240                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1241                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i]);
1242                }
1243                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1244                strm.flush();
1245        }
1246        
1247        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1248                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1249                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1250                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1251                        if (i == 0)
1252                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1253                        else
1254                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1255                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1256                                if (j == 0) 
1257                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1258                                else
1259                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1260                        }
1261                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1262                }
1263                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1264                strm.flush();
1265        }
1266
1267        // Exceptions ---------------------
1268        
1269        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {
1270                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1271                
1272                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
1273                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
1274                }
1275        }
1276        
1277        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
1278                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1279                
1280                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
1281                        super("square matrix expected");
1282                }
1283        }
1284        
1285        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
1286                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1287                
1288                public SameSourceTargetException() {
1289                        super("source and target must not be the same");
1290                }
1291        }
1292        
1293        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {
1294                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1295                
1296                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
1297                        super("vector length must be greater that 0");
1298                }
1299        }
